natural solution: We consider both inequalities separately. The left inequality is equivalent to \[\frac{x^2 - 14x + 11}{x^2 - 2x + 3} + 1 > 0,\]or \[\frac{2x^2 - 16x + 14}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Then \[\frac{x^2 - 8x + 7}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]The numerator factors as

\[\frac{(x - 1)(x - 7)}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]The denominator $x^2 - 2x + 3 = (x - 1)^2 + 2$ is always positive. The quadratic $(x - 1)(x - 7)$ is positive precisely when $x < 1$ or $x > 7.$ The right inequality is equivalent to

\[1 - \frac{x^2 - 14x + 11}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0,\]or \[\frac{12x - 8}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Then \[\frac{3x - 2}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Since the denominator is always positive, this inequality holds if and only if $x > \frac{2}{3}.$

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "-1 < (x powr 2 - 14 * x + 11) / (x powr 2 - 2 * x + 3)"
and h1 : "(x powr 2 - 14 * x + 11) / (x powr 2 - 2 * x + 3) < 1"
shows  "(2/3 < x \<and> x < 1) \<or> 7 < x"

(* ### Problem
 Solve
\[-1 < \frac{x^2 - 14x + 11}{x^2 - 2x + 3} < 1.\] The final Answer is \left( \frac{2}{3}, 1 \right) \cup (7,\infty)
 ### Proof
 We consider both inequalities separately. The left inequality is equivalent to \[\frac{x^2 - 14x + 11}{x^2 - 2x + 3} + 1 > 0,\]or \[\frac{2x^2 - 16x + 14}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Then \[\frac{x^2 - 8x + 7}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]The numerator factors as

 \[1 - \frac{x^2 - 14x + 11}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0,\]or \[\frac{12x - 8}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Then \[\frac{3x - 2}{x^2 - 2x + 3} > 0.\]Since the denominator is always positive, this inequality holds if and only if $x > \frac{2}{3}.$
 The solution is then \[x \in \boxed{\left( \frac{2}{3}, 1 \right) \cup (7,\infty)}.\]
 *)
